name: The Jacobean
description: McCarthy's take on a Manhattan makes use of green chartreuse; "The Jacobeans always sided with the French, so my chartreuse drink is named for them." AnCnoc is stirred with Carpano Antica ("the more savory of the sweet vermouths"), a half-ounce of green chartreuse, and a good measure of ice.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir all liquid ingredients together with ice in a mixing glass. Let sit for a minute or so to let ice start to melt. Strain into a coupe. Twist lemon on top and use as garnish.
